info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 9:04PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Crockett County through 1000 PM CDT... At 903 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Ft Lancaster, or 10 miles northeast of Sheffield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ozona around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290 and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 331 and 368. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
